results.title: Measurement in the metal working industry. No. 2. Micrometer
results.creator_credit: United States. Office of Education and Loucks and Norling Studios
results.brief_description: An explanation of the basic principles on which the micrometer works: correct care, use and maintenance of a micrometer; the various types of micrometers developed to measure outside lengths, inside lengths and depths.

results.title: Measured for transport
results.creator_credit: Edgar H. Anstey, British Information Services and Ronald Craigen
results.brief_description: British transport shows its resourcefulness when a 123-ton transformer has to be carried to a remote site in Wales. Specially devised and strictly scheduled plans are put into operation by road and rail services, and safe delivery from factory to power station is accomplished. Remote rural sections of the route pose special problems but also provide views of Wales’ lovely countryside. Music by Edward Williams. Commentator Richard Baker.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edgar H. Anstey, British Information Services and Ronald Craigen

results.title: Measure weight
results.brief_description: Introduces the concept of measuring weight in metric units. Shows two girls as they visit a chemist to learn about the standard units of weight. Tells how they use their new knowledge to compare the weight of common things in their home to make a metric cake.
results.description: Introduces the concept of measuring weight in metric units. Shows two girls as they visit a chemist to learn about the standard units of weight. Tells how they use their new knowledge to compare the weight of common things in their home to make a metric cake.

results.title: Measure of man
results.creator_credit: John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Tony Guy
results.brief_description: A brief animated history of measurement which shows that measuring is arbitrary and that counting is not. The most important advantage of the metric system of measurement is the interrelationship of the units. Common metric units are whosn within their range of application.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Halas, Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films and Tony Guy

results.title: Measure of care: Alligator Rivers region
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, David Roberts and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Alligator Rivers Region”.
Following an environmental impact study by Mr Justice Fox, the Australian Government set up the Office of the Supervising Scientist to carry out scientific research in the Alligator River region of Kakadu National Park to establish base-line figures which would enable scientists to monitor the mining activities. This documentary deals in some detail with this research, and discusses the problems associated with mining in such an unusual and beautiful part of Kakadu National Park. Narrated by Robyn Williams.

results.title: Measure metric: length 3: the final test
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how to estimate the lengths of various objects. Demonstrates estimation, measurement, recording, selecting an appropriate instrument, and using equivalents and decimal notation. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Measure metric: length 2: a thousand clicks
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how to measure circular objects and record the answers using decimal notation, how to measure lengths that are more than one metre, and how to use the trundle wheel to measure a kilometre. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Measure metric: length 1: who measures?
results.brief_description: Two teenage boys explore metric measurement in downtown Toronto. Demonstrates proper length-measuring technqiues, using the appropriate measurement instrument, and learning the linea equivalents of 1m, 10cm, 1000cm. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Measure metric. Vol. 3. Doc Cranshaw and the kid: the winner
results.brief_description:
The grandson of a medicine man wins a contest by mastering metric volume measurement. Demonstrates the use of formula, the relationship and the principle of water displacement to determine the volume of non-rectangular objects.
Suitable for middle and upper primary level.
